name: Smith, Appellant, v. Zoning Board of Adjustment
name_abbreviation: Smith v. Zoning Board of Adjustment

judges: Before Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
parties: Smith, Appellant, v. Zoning Board of Adjustment.
attorneys: Edward Unterberger, with Mm Samuel Pachman and Stanton W. Kratzoh, for appellants.

Matthew W. Bulloch, Jr., Deputy City Solicitor, with him Carl K. Zucher, Assistant City Solicitor, James L. Stern, Second Deputy City Solicitor, and Edward G. Bauer, Jr., City Solicitor, for zoning board, appellee.
William T. Coleman, Jr., with him Louis E. Levinthal, Harold E. Kohn, Bruce W. Kauffman, Harry A. Rutenberg, and Dilworth, Paxson, Kalish, Kohn & Dilles, for intervenors.
casebody.head_matter:
Smith, Appellant, v. Zoning Board of Adjustment.
Argued April 28, 1964.
Before Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
reargument refused November 9, 1964.
Edward Unterberger, with Mm Samuel Pachman and Stanton W. Kratzoh, for appellants.
Matthew W. Bulloch, Jr., Deputy City Solicitor, with him Carl K. Zucher, Assistant City Solicitor, James L. Stern, Second Deputy City Solicitor, and Edward G. Bauer, Jr., City Solicitor, for zoning board, appellee.
William T. Coleman, Jr., with him Louis E. Levinthal, Harold E. Kohn, Bruce W. Kauffman, Harry A. Rutenberg, and Dilworth, Paxson, Kalish, Kohn & Dilles, for intervenors.
September 29, 1964:
